channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: China's industrial profits fall by 10% in October as deflation worries linger
item.description: Industrial profits are a key gauge of the financial health of factories, mines and utilities in China.

item.title: New Zealand expectedly cuts benchmark rate by 50 basis points as economy struggles
item.description: New Zealand's central bank slashed its benchmark interest rate by 50 basis points to 4.25%, marking a third straight cut to its benchmark interest rate.

item.title: The shipping industry is wrestling with one of its largest challenges
item.description: The shipping industry is contending with a shortage of seafarers, and it's fueling a troubling mix of fake resumes, accidents at sea, and higher freight rates.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: A new day, a new Trump policy for markets to digest
item.description: Even before Trump enters the White House, investors are already living in his world.

item.title: Donald Trump selects Kevin Hassett to lead National Economic Council
item.description: The appointment came as Donald Trump renewed his vow to raise tariffs on imports from China, Mexico and Canada.

item.title: Israel-Hezbollah permanent ceasefire has been accepted, Biden says
item.description: Israel and Lebanon have agreed to a permanent ceasefire in cross-border hostilities between the Jewish state and Hezbollah militants.

item.title: Can Saudi Arabia keep pace with its ambitious mega-project spending spree?
item.description: "Saudi Arabia has poured tens of billions into projects that have yet to hint of any financial returns," one financier told CNBC.

item.title: Trumpâ€™s tariff threats signal the start of a wild ride in currency markets
item.description: Donald Trump's vow to implement additional tariffs on China, Canada and Mexico signals the start of a wild ride in currency markets, strategists say.

item.title: Workday stock slips on light quarterly forecast
item.description: Workday called for a 25% adjusted operating margin in the current quarter, below Wall Street's estimate of 25.5%.

item.title: Dell shares fall on light forecast despite growing AI sales
item.description: Dell is a top vendor for computers required to develop and deploy artificial intelligence, especially computers based around Nvidia chips.

item.title: Trump vows an additional 10% tariff on China, 25% tariffs on Canada and Mexico
item.description: The president-elect plans to raise tariffs by an additional 10% on all Chinese goods coming into the U.S., according to a post on his social media platform Truth Social.

item.title: Jim Cramer defends cryptocurrency support: 'National debt worries are never going to go away'
item.description: CNBC's Jim Cramer on Tuesday defended his stance on cryptocurrency.

item.title: Fed officials see interest rate cuts ahead, but only 'gradually,' meeting minutes show
item.description: Federal Reserve officials expressed confidence that inflation is easing and the labor market is strong, allowing for further interest rate cuts albeit at a gradual pace.

item.title: Bitcoin slides toward $90,000 as price moves back after postelection rally
item.description: Bitcoin retreated further from the psychological $100,000 milestone as investors booked profits from the token's gains following the presidential election.

item.title: Meet the start-up working to save newborn babies and democratize pregnancy care
item.description: More than two million babies died in the first 20 days of their lives in 2022, and a startup, Biorithm, hopes to help prevent this with its monitoring device.

item.title: Senate report slams airlines for raking in billions in seat fees
item.description: The Senate panel is calling airline executives to testify next week about their carriers' fees.

item.title: Databricks closes in on multibillion funding round at $55 billion valuation to help employees cash out
item.description: Databricks is raising at least $5 billion in cash â€” though it could raise as much as $8 billion â€” pegging its new valuation at $55 billion, sources say.

item.title: Huawei launches first phones capable of running its new self-developed operating system
item.description: Huawei launched the Mate 70, Mate 70 Pro and Mate 70 Pro+ and foldable Mate X6 on Tuesday that can run HarmonyOS NEXT, its self-developed operating system.

item.title: Banco BPM says UniCredit's 'unusual' $10.5 billion takeover offer does not reflect its profitability
item.description: UniCredit offered to snap up Banco BPM for roughly $10.5 billion on Monday.

item.title: Amgen says obesity drug caused up to 20% weight loss after a year, with no plateau
item.description: The results shed light on how MariTide may measure up to weight loss injections from Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly and other experimental treatments.

item.title: Orange partners with OpenAI, Meta to develop custom African-language AI models
item.description: Orange is working with OpenAI and Meta to build custom AI models that can understand West African languages not understood by most conversational systems.

item.title: Six travelers in Laos died from suspected tainted alcohol. Here's where most incidents occur
item.description: Six travelers have died from suspected methanol poisoning in Vang Vieng, Laos. Most of these incidents occur in Asia, according to Doctors Without Borders.

item.title: Heathrow boss says 2025 to bring final decision on controversial third runway
item.description: Thomas Woldbye told the Airlines 2024 conference he expected a final decision "one way or another" on the long-running project by the end of 2025.

item.title: Adani Group's troubles keep growing as financial and legal headwinds get stronger
item.description: Adina Group's troubles are only growing as financial and legal headwinds get stronger

item.title: What Trump's pick for Treasury secretary could mean for global markets
item.description: Strategists regard hedge fund manager Scott Bessent, founder of Connecticut-based investment firm Key Square Group, as a "safe pair of hands."

item.title: Tim Cook and other U.S. executives attend China expo, meet officials as Trump tariff threat looms
item.description: A number of high-profile American business leaders are in China this week for the country's second annual international supply chain expo, including Apple's Tim Cook.

item.title: Bitcoin's march to $100,000 stalls. Here's what's keeping it below the milestone
item.description: Bitcoin is trading stubbornly below the $100,000 mark, putting the brakes on a blistering post-election rally.

item.title: Walmart pulls back on DEI efforts, removes some LGBTQ merchandise from website
item.description: The big-box retailer, the nation's largest, joins a growing list of companies feeling the heat from conservative activists.

item.title: Wall Street launches new ways to bet on bitcoin
item.description: Wall Street launches new trading tools to bet on the price of bitcoin

item.title: Virgin Atlantic CEO says UK budget is 'tax on growth' with air duties set to rise
item.description: Shai Weiss said that despite aviation's contribution to the economy, "all we've seen is an increase in Air Passenger Duty."
